medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe immunocompromised state due to HIV-1 infection in children.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The children were selected based on CD4 T lymphocyte counts of <20 cells/mL and histories of opportunistic infections. Their clinical status indicated imminent deaths compared to other children in the home. They initiated structured treatment interruption (STI) regimen in August 2000, leading to marked improvement, including increases in CD4 counts and reduction in plasma HIV-1 RNA levels over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic HIV-1 infection, CD4 T lymphocyte counts <20 cells/mL, and history of opportunistic infections.
medical_history.social_history: Residing at Nyumbani Children's Home in Nairobi, Kenya, which provides comprehensive care and routine antiretroviral treatment alongside adequate nutrition and supplementation.
